Package: org.weceem.services

[Groovy] Class WcmContentFingerprintService

    • org.weceem.services.WcmContentFingerprintService
    • All Implemented Interfaces and Traits:
      org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean

      class WcmContentFingerprintService

      Service that is responsible for caching and calculating fingerprints of individual content nodes and also "tree" fingerprints representing the fingerprint of all the descendents of a node. This information is used in the ETag handling and relies heavily on the dependency service. NOTE: This is really complicated. The issues around cyclic node dependencies and avoiding calculating hashes that change during their own calculation (e.g. tree hashes) hurt your brain. Do not change any of this without fully understanding it.

      Authors:
      Marc Palmer (marc@grailsrocks.com)

        • java.lang.Object doUpdateFingerprintFor(WcmContent content, java.util.Set<WcmContent> alreadyVisited = [])

          This method must ONLY update the fingerprint for this one node. This means: - no side effects should cause other nodes to update i.e. no getFingerprintFor - any dependent nodes FPs must only be updated at the end of the method

        • java.lang.Object updateFingerprintFor(WcmContent content, java.util.Set<WcmContent> alreadyVisited = [])

          This method must ONLY update the fingerprint for this one node. This means: - no side effects should cause other nodes to update i.e. no getFingerprintFor - any dependent nodes FPs must only be updated at the end of the method This invalidates dependent fingerprints so that they can be recalculated without stack overflow

        • protected java.lang.Object updateFingerprintsForAllDependencies(java.lang.Object nodesNeedingRecalculation, java.util.Set<WcmContent> alreadyVisited)

          Update fingerprints for a dependency list, without recursing into their dependencies The dependency list will usually include all the transitive depenencies, and this prevents stack overflow
